titleInfo.title: Louisiana Civil Rights Movement Oral History Project
titleInfo.subTitle: John Zippert oral history interview, 1998

name.description: John Zippert was born in New York City on November 13, 1945. He joined CORE while at the City College of New York and volunteered in Louisiana during the summer of 1965. His first job came with the Southern Cooperative Development Program in 1967. Zippert joined the Federation of Southern Cooperatives in Epes, Alabama in 1970.

subject.topic: City University of New York.--City College.
Grand Marie Sweet Potato Marketing Cooperative.

mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries Special Collections (http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special)
mods.accessCondition: Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright is retained by Louisiana State University in accordance with U.S. copyright laws.

"E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments. See instructions for ordering reprints of this audio here: http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special/services/duplication.html Mention the ""Item number"" or ""Item URL"" in your request. "
mods.abstract: Zippert describes his political activity while at the City College of New York, his experiences as a CORE summer volunteer in Louisiana, and his involvement in the Grand Marie Sweet Potato Marketing Cooperative. He discusses his work with the Southern Cooperative Development Program and the Federation of Southern Cooperatives, being investigated by the FBI and the Joint Legislative Committee on Un-American Activities, and his participation in removing the miscegenation statute in Louisiana.
